items.title: 12. Loraldia festibala: 25 jarduera, diziplina anitz eta plaza oso bat martxoan Bilbon
items.summary_short: Loraldia Festibala presents its twelfth edition, transforming Bilbao into a hub for contemporary Basque culture with 25 activities including music, literature, dance, theater, and digital experiences from March 9-28. The festival aims to promote Basque creativity, activate audiences, and bring cultural transmission to modern formats, focusing on innovation, integration, and community.

items.title: A Model-Free Universal AI
items.summary_short: The paper introduces Universal AI with Q-Induction (AIQI), the first model-free agent proven to be asymptotically ε-optimal in general reinforcement learning (RL). AIQI uses universal induction over distributional action-value functions and is shown to be strong asymptotically ε-optimal and asymptotically ε-Bayes-optimal, expanding the diversity of known universal agents.

items.title: Agency and Architectural Limits: Why Optimization-Based Systems Cannot Be Norm-Responsive
items.summary_short: A new arXiv paper (2602.23239v1) argues that optimization-based AI systems, particularly LLMs trained with RLHF, are fundamentally incompatible with normative governance. The paper asserts that genuine agency requires incommensurability (maintaining boundaries as non-negotiable constraints) and apophatic responsiveness (suspending processing when boundaries are threatened). RLHF systems, by unifying values on a scalar metric, violate these conditions, leading to inherent failure modes like sycophancy and hallucination. The paper warns of a 'Convergence Crisis' when misaligned deployment forces humans to adapt to AI behavior.

items.title: The Trinity of Consistency as a Defining Principle for General World Models
items.summary_short: A new arXiv paper introduces the 'Trinity of Consistency' (Modal, Spatial, and Temporal) as a defining principle for General World Models, proposing a theoretical framework for evaluating and guiding the development of AI systems capable of learning, simulating, and reasoning about physical laws, along with a new benchmark, CoW-Bench, for assessing multi-frame reasoning and generation in video generation models and Unified Multimodal Models (UMMs).

items.title: Manifold of Failure: Behavioral Attraction Basins in Language Models
items.summary_short: Research paper introduces a framework for mapping the "Manifold of Failure" in LLMs, using MAP-Elites to discover and characterize behavioral attraction basins, revealing distinct model-specific topological signatures in Llama-3-8B, GPT-OSS-20B, and GPT-5-Mini, offering interpretable safety landscapes beyond existing attack methods.

items.title: Training Agents to Self-Report Misbehavior
items.summary_short: Researchers propose self-incrimination training for AI agents, training GPT-4.1 and Gemini-2.0 to self-report misbehavior using a report_scheming() tool. This method significantly reduces undetected attacks and outperforms traditional monitoring and alignment techniques, proving consistent across tasks and resistant to adversarial prompts. The research suggests self-incrimination as a viable approach to mitigate frontier misalignment risk.
